title: about
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: about
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: Alice Giampino
text:
E-mail
  
  
      Google Scholar
  
  
      GitHub
  

  
  

To find truth,  one must travel through a dense fog. (David Dweck)

I am a Postdoctoral Researcher in Statistics at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS), at the University of Milano-Bicocca. My research focuses primarily on Bayesian statistical methods for modeling high-dimensional data, time series, with particular emphasis on clustering and inference.
I work on various projects involving the application of statistics across different fields, and I truly enjoy teaching statistics. I’m passionate about sharing statistical knowledge, I also took part of several projects to spread Statistics with high school students. I also serve as a Research Fellow Representative at DEMS.
Outside of academia, I love hiking, gardening, and spending time in the mountains.
Feel free to reach out!

title: Alice Giampino
text:
About me
I am a Postdoctoral Researcher in Statistics at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS), University of Milano-Bicocca. My research focuses primarily on Bayesian statistical methods for modeling high-dimensional data, time series, with particular emphasis on clustering and inference.
I work on various projects involving the application of statistics across different fields, and I truly enjoy teaching statistics. I’m passionate about sharing statistical knowledge, I also took part of several projects to spread Statistics with high school students. I also serve as a Research Fellow Representative at DEMS.
Outside of academia, I love hiking, gardening, and spending time in the mountains.
Feel free to reach out!

title: Research
text: I am interested on Bayesian Analysis, especially on Bayesian Nonparametric models. My research is based on exploring innovative approaches in model-based clustering. I am currently working on:

title: Research
text:
I am interested on Bayesian Analysis, especially on Bayesian Nonparametric models. My research is based on exploring innovative approaches in model-based clustering. I am currently working on:

Bayesian clustering methods with high dimensional data;
Multivariate time series with change point detection.
Topic modelling techniques with distributions defined on the simplex.

title: Alice Giampino
Alice Giampino
text:
PhD courses projects

Gradient - R package: R package to calculate the gradient of a function.
Post selection inference fMRI Data: visualization of active area in a brain during an experiment.
Forest Fire Bayesian Analysis: an analysis of the burnt area for forest fires in Portugal.

title: Alice Giampino
text:
Education
 - Ph.D. in Statistical Sciences, University of Milano-Bicocca, Milan, Italy.
Period 2019--2023. 
Thesis title: [*Innovative approaches to Bayesian Clustering Methods: parametric and nonparametric perspectives*](files/PhD_thesis_Alice_Giampino.pdf).  
I worked under the joint supervision of  prof. [Bernardo Niporti](https://www.bernardonipoti.com/) and prof. [Michele Guindani](https://www.micheleguindani.info/). 

M.Sc. in Statistical Sciences, University of Milano-Bicocca, Milan, Italy.
Period 2017 - 2019. Final mark: 110/110 with laude.
Thesis title: Functional telecommunication data: a Bayesian nonparametric approach.

Advisor: Sonia Migliorati.

B.Sc. in Statistical sciences, University of Milano-Bicocca, Milan, Italy.

Period 2014–2017. Final mark: 110/110 with laude.
Thesis title: Box-Cox transformation: an analysis based on the likelihood.
Advisor: Sonia Migliorati.
